expectations.expectationDescription: Understand that the context of an art object has an effect on how that object is perceived.
Identify and communicate how historical and cultural contexts influence ideas that inform artists.
Investigate the role of cultural objects in our everyday environment.
Compare and contrast how form and style are influenced by social, environmental and political views in artworks.
Focus attention on selected artworks to identify and pose questions about aesthetic qualities (e.g., sensory, organizational, emotional) in the works.
Select and access contemporary digital tools and media arts to investigate ideas and inform artmaking.

objectives.objectiveDescription: Generate, create, realize, use & master skills

expectations.expectationDescription: Integrate observational and technical skills to strengthen artmaking.
Use digital tools to explore ideas, create and refine works of art during the artmaking process.
Experiment with various ideas and visual art media to solve a problem that addresses a contemporary social issue.
Select and use the elements and principles of art and design to communicate understanding of an interdisciplinary concept.
During collaborative artmaking experiences, demonstrate respect and support for peer ideas and creativity.
Apply reasoning skills to analyze and interpret the meaning in artworks.
Describe how personal experiences can influence artistic preferences.
Explain the reasons and value of documenting and preserving works of art and art objects in some cultures.
Communicate how personal artistic decisions are influenced by social, environmental and political views.
Express what was learned and the challenges that remain when assessing their artworks.
Use criteria to assess works of art individually and collaboratively

sections.sectionDescription: Understand that the context of an art object has an effect on how that object is perceived.
Identify and communicate how historical and cultural contexts influence ideas that inform artists.
Investigate the role of cultural objects in our everyday environment.
Compare and contrast how form and style are influenced by social, environmental, and political views in artworks.
Focus attention on selected artworks to identify and pose questions about aesthetic qualities (e.g., sensory, organizational, emotional) in the works.
Select and access contemporary digital tools and media arts to investigate ideas and inform artmaking.
Integrate observational and technical skills to strengthen artmaking.
Use digital tools to explore ideas, create and refine works of art during the artmaking process.
Experiment with various ideas and visual art media to solve a problem that addresses a contemporary social issue.
Select and use the elements and principles of art and design to communicate understanding of an interdisciplinary concept.
During collaborative artmaking experiences, demonstrate respect and support for peer ideas and creativity.
Apply reasoning skills to analyze and interpret the meaning in artworks.
Describe how personal experiences can influence artistic preferences.
Explain the reasons and value of documenting and preserving works of art and art objects in some cultures.
Communicate how personal artistic decisions are influenced by social, environmental, and political views.
Express what was learned and the challenges that remain when assessing their artworks.
Use criteria to assess works of art individually and collaboratively.
Review the understanding of how the context of an art object affects perception and how historical and cultural contexts influence artists.
Review the integration of observational and technical skills in artmaking and the use of digital tools in creating art.
Review experiments with various ideas and visual art media to solve problems addressing contemporary social issues.
Review the selection and use of elements and principles of art and design to communicate understanding of interdisciplinary concepts.
Review respect and support for peer ideas and creativity during collaborative artmaking experiences.
Review reasoning skills applied to analyze and interpret the meaning in artworks.
Review how personal experiences can influence artistic preferences.
Review the reasons and value of documenting and preserving works of art and art objects in some cultures.
Review how personal artistic decisions are influenced by social, environmental, and political views.
Review criteria to assess works of art individually and collaboratively.
Students create cultural artifacts that demonstrate their understanding of historical and cultural influences.
Students use digital tools to create and refine works of art that address contemporary social issues.
Students work collaboratively to create art projects that demonstrate respect and support for peer ideas and creativity.
Students analyze and interpret the meaning in selected artworks, applying reasoning skills.
Students plan and organize an art exhibition, incorporating their cultural artifacts, digital art creations, and collaborative projects.
Students set up their art exhibition, arranging artworks and preparing presentations.
Students present their artworks and discuss the influences, techniques, and meanings behind their creations.
Review key concepts learned throughout the course and reflect on personal growth and understanding.
Celebrate the achievements and progress made throughout the course with a class celebration and sharing session.
